wikipedia_page.main:
Hugh Gray (19 April 1916 – 1 April 2002) was a British Labour Party politician and lecturer at the University of London.
In 1966 he defeated the Conservative incumbent Anthony Fell to become the Member of Parliament (MP) for Yarmouth until 1970, when Fell regained the seat from him. He unsuccessfully fought South Norfolk in October 1974 but never re-entered Parliament.
Gray died on 1 April 2002, aged 85.

link_mentions.page: List of MPs elected in the 1966 United Kingdom general election

response: He was elected at the 1951 general election as Member of Parliament (MP) for Great Yarmouth, a seat which had been held at the start of the 20th century by his grandfather Sir Arthur Fell.  Yarmouth returned him to the Commons at three further elections.  At the 1966 general election, Labour's Hugh Gray won the seat, with a majority of 797.
* Hugh Gray, Labour MP for Great Yarmouth from 1966 to 1970
